newsitem.title: UK: UK's OFT to seek referral of Bass deal - report.
newsitem.headline: UK's OFT to seek referral of Bass deal - report.

text.p: The UK's Office of Fair Trading will recommend that the government refer the takeover of Carlsberg-Tetley by Bass to the Monopolies and Mergers Commission, the Independent said on Tuesday.

Senior officials at the OFT are applying the finishing touches to a report that will call for a full MMC investigation and are expected to pass their recommendation to the Department of Trade and Industry in the next fortnight, the newspaper said.
In August, Bass struck a complex deal to take control of Carlsberg-Tetley, the brewing venture owned by Allied Domecq and Denmark's Carlsberg.

Bass agreed to pay 200 million stg for Allied's 50 percent stake in the venture and said it would merge its acqusition with Bass Brewers. Carlsberg is to acquire a 20 percent stake in the merged company in return for its stake in Carlsberg- Tetley.
The deal would leave Bass as Britain's largest brewer with over 35 percent of the market and some 4,000 pubs.
